briefTitle: The Anti-Freaze-F Study- "Anti-TNF for Treatment of Frozen Shoulder - a Feasibility Study"

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Eligible With Pain Predominant Frozen Shoulder
outcomeMeasures.description: Ability to screen and identify potential participants with pain-predominant early stage frozen shoulder (i.e. within approximately 3 months of onset of symptoms).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Consenting to be Included in the Trial
outcomeMeasures.description: Willingness of eligible participants to consent and be randomised to intervention.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time From Randomisation to First Injection
outcomeMeasures.description: Practicalities of delivering the intervention, including time to first injection (within 2 weeks of randomisation).

outcomeMeasures.title: Time From First Injection to Second Injection
outcomeMeasures.description: Practicalities of delivering the intervention, including time between first injection and second injection (within 4-6 weeks of randomisation).

outcomeMeasures.title: Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Score ranges from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate better outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain (Shoulder Pain And Disability Index, 5-item Subscale)
outcomeMeasures.description: Score ranges from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate better outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: Function (Shoulder Pain And Disability Index, 8-item Subscale)
outcomeMeasures.description: Score ranges from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate better outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: Fear Avoidance Belief Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Score ranges from 0 to 24, higher scores indicate better outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Self Efficacy Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Score ranges from 0 to 12, higher scores indicate better outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Insomnia Severity Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Sleep disturbance measured using the Insomnia Severity Index, score ranges from 0 to 28, higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Return to Desired Activities (RDA)
outcomeMeasures.description: Return to desired activities measured using an adapted version of the Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand (QUICKDASH) questionnaire. Score ranges from 3 to 15, lower scores indicate better outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Global Impression of Change
outcomeMeasures.description: This was measured using the Likert scale. Score ranges from -5 (very much worse) to +5 (completely recovered) with a value of 0 suggesting no change. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Health Resource Use
outcomeMeasures.description: Consultation with primary and secondary care, additional physiotherapy, injection use, or alternative therapies for index shoulder

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Events Graded 3 or Above
outcomeMeasures.description:
Any adverse event (graded 3 or above) that has resulted from the trial.

The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0 was used to guide recording adverse events including grading of the event. Grade 3: Severe symptoms or medically significant but not life-threatening but may be disabling or limit self care in Activities of Daily Living. Grade 4: Life threatening consequences; urgent or emergent intervention needed. Grade 5: Death related to or due to adverse event.

outcomeMeasures.title: Shoulder Range of Movement
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinician assessed (goniometry measured) active shoulder flexion, extension, abduction, internal and external rotation. Range of flexion and abduction: 0-180 degrees. Range of extension, internal rotation and external rotation: 0-90 degrees.
